The director¶

spyral.director manages the running scenes.

class spyral.scene.Director[source]¶

The director, accessible at spyral.director, handles running the game. It will switch between scenes and call their render and update methods as necessary

get_camera()[source]¶

Returns the root camera for the display.

get_scene()[source]¶

Returns the currently running scene.

get_tick()[source]¶

Returns the current tick number, where ticks happen on each update, not on each frame.

init(size=(0, 0), fullscreen=False, caption='spyral', max_fps=60, ticks_per_second=30)[source]¶

Initializes the director.

size is the resolution of the display. (0,0) uses the screen resolution
fullscreen determines whether the display starts fullscreen
caption is the window caption
max_fps sets the fps cap on the game.
ticks_per_second sets the number of times scene.update() should be called per frame. This will remain the same, even if fps drops.
pop()[source]¶

Pop the top scene off the stack, returning control to the next scene on the stack. If the stack is empty, the program will quit.

push(scene)[source]¶

Place scene on the top of the stack, and move control to it.

replace(scene)[source]¶

Replace the currently running scene on the stack with scene.

run()[source]¶

Runs the scene as dictated by the stack. Does not return.
